title: A small camera zoom out for Vel Koz ult, quality of life
body:
The beam extends beyond the camera at certain angles and I find myself having to manipulate the camera while also aiming the ult.

Just a small camera zoom out during the ult would be great for usability

I've been playing Vel for a while, and I am perfectly fine with the way his ultimate works. I don't play with a locked in camera so I don't exactly need velkoz in my view in order to be efficient with it.
So I guess this doesn't apply to you.

It does, though, because if we end up using a watered-down version of Jhin's cam zoom, it's going to take cam control away and snap it back to the champion.  So whatever change is going to HAVE to be a toggle-option in Controls for those of us who are used to using his ult as is.
Xerath's doesn't do that.
you can still move camera with Xerath's Zoom out, and i'm pretty sure it doesn't snap back
I hate Vel'Koz, but I agree with this. Some modernization would be nice (though make my laning against him harder).
That's not quality of life, that's a buff.
But jhin and xerath can have the same exact thing?

They have to recast their ults to do anything, vel has a persistent one. They have the zoom to be more accurate with their incredible range, vel's doesn't have as much range and his laser is persistent and doesn't have much warning

So what is your point? They have to recast their ults, so they get a zoomed out camera? All op is asking for is that the the camera be zoomed out in order for the whole range of the laser to be in range. That isn't a buff.

When your camera zooms out your cursor moves. If it zooms out your vel koz ult accuracy will be greatly hampered because you get to reposition your cursor with the others and not with the persistent vel koz laser.
